speaker: Verso
line: Follow the tracks, they’ll lead us to Monoco.

speaker: Maelle
line: A train. Gustave would have liked to see that.

speaker: Lune
line: Is it true, before the Fracture, Lumière had trains running throughout the continent?

speaker: Verso
line: Always running late, but running, yes.

speaker: Verso
line: Here we are. Monoco’s Station.

speaker: Lune
line: Is that a Grandis? I knew it! They’re real too!

speaker: Grandis Guard
line: Contrary to what some believe, guard duty is quite rewarding. I find it meditative and instructional.

speaker: Verso
line: If Monoco’s not here, that means– Slow as ever, mon vieux.

speaker: Monoco
line: Your reflexes remain sharp as ever. I approve.

speaker: Esquie
line: MOMO!

speaker: Monoco
line: Esquie! Did Verso pull you into another adventure? Mmm. New friends?

speaker: Lune
line: You speak our language?

speaker: Verso
line: We had a lot of time to kill, so I taught him.

speaker: Monoco
line: Ladies. Could I OW– interest you in a duel?

speaker: Maelle
line: Yep, definitely a Gestral.

speaker: Verso
line: No point trying to talk until we’ve calmed Monoco down with a “relaxing” fight. Be careful though, Monoco’s fighting style is a bit… peculiar.

speaker: Noco
line: Woo, woo, woo, woo, woo! NEVRON!! Oh, hi.

speaker: Monoco
line: No distractions, son! I’m really busy beating up strangers.

speaker: Maelle
line: Noco! What’re you doing here?

speaker: Noco
line: Even with Esquie, you’re still so slow! Oh! Where’s the man with the weird arm?

speaker: Verso
line: Uh. Noco, you said Nevron?

speaker: Noco
line: Oh, yeah! A Stalact is approaching! The Grandis are taking cover. Come on, come on!

speaker: Monoco
line: Oh. Hm. A Stalact.

speaker: Monoco
line: Friends of Verso. As “Honoured Guests,” the first fight is yours! Defeat the Stalact with your fearsome talents!

speaker: Sciel
line: Right. Oh. You’re serious.

speaker: Verso
line: Yes, he is. You little coward.

speaker: Monoco
line: You’ve found worthy friends, Verso.

speaker: Verso
line: Jealous?

speaker: Sciel
line: What are you doing?

speaker: Monoco
line: I just need… the foot. Ahah!

speaker: Verso
line: He transforms by collecting Nevron feet. Don’t ask me how it works, I’ve never understood.

speaker: Monoco
line: Now that we’ve had some good battles to warm the spirits, to what do we owe the pleasure of your company?

speaker: Verso
line: We are heading for Old Lumière.

speaker: Monoco
line: Ok, bye.

speaker: Verso
line: Hey, come on. Hey! Hey, look, I know we failed before, but– Look, you doofus, don’t you recognize her?

speaker: Monoco
line: Of course, I do–

speaker: Verso
line: Then you know what that means. This our shot, it might be our only shot.

speaker: Monoco
line: This is YOUR only shot. Out of question. I will never join you again.

speaker: Verso
line: There will be a lot of fighting though.

speaker: Monoco
line: Oh yeah, that’s true.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, that’s true.

speaker: Monoco
line: There will be a lot of fighting.

speaker: Verso
line: Exactly.

speaker: Monoco
line: Count me in then.

speaker: Verso
line: Good.

speaker: Monoco
line: Good.

speaker: Verso
line: Good.

speaker: Monoco
line: Good.

speaker: Verso
line: Yes, good.

speaker: Maelle
line: Noco’s coming too.

speaker: Verso
line: You are???

speaker: Noco
line: Not a lot of merchants go to Old Lumière! There will be tons of rare shiny treasure and then I shall be– THE UNDISPUTED. TOP. MERCHANT. IN THE WORLD!

speaker: Monoco
line: As a responsible parent, this is a superb idea. Let us go. To Old Lumière.

speaker: Noco
line: Oh, the Grandis came out now that the Stalact is gone! You should go talk to them, they’re nicer than Gestrals. If you want to go to Old Lymière, you should take this exit then head north.

speaker: Grandis Cleaner 1
line: I can clear the snow and I can clear the rubble, but this is too much.

speaker: Grandis Cleaner 2
line: Must we truly dispose of this thing? It does not obstruct the way. It is simply… there.

speaker: Grandis Historian
line: As some of us forget the history of our people, I thought it prudent to begin recording what I can.

speaker: Lune
line: That is great to hear. Do you write, then?

speaker: Grandis Historian
line: No, no. I record everything in my mind. If someone forgets our history, I will simply tell them!

speaker: Lune
line: But what if you forget?

speaker: Grandis Historian
line: Let me think on that.

speaker: Grandis Sculptor
line: I remember sculpting this statue. I must say… looking back now… Why did we all sculpt the same thing?

speaker: Grandis Historian
line: Do you not remember? There was a time when the tribes sought to compete in a different manner than through eloquence battles. So we did this.

speaker: Grandis Scout 1
line: It was pleasant meeting the merchant, but things could have become perilous. We did well to return.

speaker: Grandis Scout 2
line: There is too much we do not know about the crater. The Nevrons there are fierce.

speaker: Grandis
line: Beautiful weather today, mm? Albeit a tad warm for my liking.

speaker: Lune
line: Too warm? Really?

speaker: Grandis
line: Before the Fracture, our ancestral home lay high above the heavens, on mountains tipped with crystal clouds. Blossoms of snowflakes graced our every breath. The blizzards of yesteryear were a sight to behold… and quite invigorating to experience.

speaker: Amazed Grandis
line: It is true, the Fracture brought its share of ills, but there is beauty in its aftermath. Take these stations, scattered across the mountains. Though not their original purpose, they have sheltered us well and become our cherished home. Your ancestors rode iron horses from station to station. And though these marvels breathe fire no more, still, they are a lovely reminder of human ingenuity and they beautify our surrounds. It is astonishing, is it not? The many wonders your ancestors have wrought.

speaker: Lune
line: I think you would enjoy a visit to Lumière.

speaker: Amazed Grandis
line: Oh yes. I would very much love to go to Lumière one day.

speaker: Grumpy Grandis
line: The Grandis lived peaceful lives long before the Paintress emerged. The three great Grandis tribes were renowned for the artistry of their discourse. We too once had grand arenas, like the Grestrals. But within our arenas, eloquence landed the killing blows. I still remember the excitement of the Oratory Games. Every four years, the greatest minds came together to demonstrate their mastery over the spoken word. The debates were fierce and lengthy. I recall one bout that lasted 96 hours!

speaker: Lune
line: Do you still hold these Games?

speaker: Grumpy Grandis
line: Not as they once were, for the Three great Grandis tribes no longer exist. We are all that remain. But the Games were not simply a competition between us. They were a celebration and a chance to come together. And that spirit we continue to honour. These days, our debates are more humble in nature, but that allows for a more intimate competitive environment. We have faced many challenges since the Fracture, but our traditions live on, in one form or another.

speaker: Arguing Grandis
line: Would you kindly descend from there?

speaker: Troublesome Grandis
line: No.

speaker: Grandis
line: I should… build a proper bridge one of these days.

speaker: Grandis
line: Some think to fight back, to strike directly against the Nevrons in open battle. Though we are strangers to the mindset of war and outmatched in strength and numbers. We have the will, but have we the way?

speaker: Lune
line: I don’t know, but the only chance you have is if you stand together.

speaker: Grandis
line: In that, we agree. But do we stand and fight together? Or do we retreat and flee together? Perhaps it is time to find a new home.

speaker: Grandis
line: Many challenges lie ahead, for both your kind and ours. Please. Take this.

speaker: Young Grandis
line: I can’t remember a time when we weren’t hiding from the Nevrons.

speaker: Old Grandis
line: Feels like only yesterday to me.

speaker: Grandis Scout 1
line: This pathway leads to the treacherous region of the mountains. If your destination is Old Lumière, you should leave via the other exit.

speaker: Sciel
line: Monoco seems fun.

speaker: Verso
line: Oh, yeah.

speaker: Sciel
line: Bet you guys got up to lots of trouble together.

speaker: Verso
line: That obvious, huh?

speaker: Sciel
line: You guys getting us into more trouble now?

speaker: Verso
line: An appropriate amount of trouble.

speaker: Sciel
line: Mmm. I’ve spent some time with Gestrals. I’m not sure we have the same definition of “appropriate.”

speaker: Verso
line: Ahhh, let me guess, you’ve been to one of their arenas?

speaker: Sciel
line: Reigning Champion, naturally.

speaker: Verso
line: Naturally.

speaker: Lune
line: Feet? Really?

speaker: Verso
line: Don’t worry, he’s not interested in human feet.

speaker: Lune
line: … And the bell?

speaker: Verso
line: Gift from the Grandis.

speaker: Lune
line: Amazing. I wonder if we can achieve something similar…

speaker: Verso
line: I’ll stick to my swords. I’m not too keen on turning into a Nevron.

speaker: Lune
line: If we combine this with Pictos, could we selectively use Nevron abilities in battle-

speaker: Verso
line: Okay, you seem busy. I’ll come back later.

speaker: Maelle
line: The Grandis are so gentle, who’s going to protect them while Monoco’s gone?

speaker: Verso
line: They can take care of themselves.

speaker: Maelle
line: Really?

speaker: Verso
line: They’ve got their bells. Don’t worry.

speaker: Maelle
line: What do the bells do?

speaker: Verso
line: Ringing the bells makes the Nevrons flee. Although… it only works on Nevrons with ears, so not every Nevron…

speaker: Maelle
line: Well, now I’m worried.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, actually me too.

speaker: Noco
line: Did you get my present?

speaker: Verso
line: What present?

speaker: Noco
line: The one I left in your hut! I took a special detour through Ancient Sanctuary just for you.

speaker: Verso
line: Oh, I got your note about- But I didn’t see a present? What was it?

speaker: Noco
line: Hrmph! You’ll just have to wait and find out. But it’s SUPER cool.

speaker: Verso
line: Silly patate. Thanks. How’s my favourite patate?

speaker: Noco
line: Hmph. How’s my favourite NOT-a-patate?

speaker: Verso
line: Oh, I’m still your favourite, am I? ‘Cause you’ve taken a real shine to Maelle.

speaker: Noco
line: Oooooh, jealous?? You’re the one who asked me to make friends!

speaker: Verso
line: Fair enough. So, tell me, patate to NOT-a-patate, why are you tagging along? Really.

speaker: Noco
line: What d’you mean? If I’m gonna be the GREATEST. MERCHANT. OF ALL TIME then I need to find some TREASURE.

speaker: Verso
line: I don’t believe you. Don’t tell Monoco I said this, but you were and still are the greatest SEARCHER of all time. And you know there are more Lost Gestrals out there. Why be a merchant? Why go to Old Lumière?

speaker: Noco
line: Meh.

speaker: Verso
line: MEH??

speaker: Noco
line: Lotsa other Searcher now. Just ‘cause I’m the GREATEST OF ALL TIME doesn’t mean I wanna do it forever.

speaker: Verso
line: No?

speaker: Noco
line: You know this. Forever the same SUCKS.

speaker: Verso
line: Mmmm, true.

speaker: Noco
line: See?

speaker: Verso
line: All right, all right.

speaker: Noco
line: Besides, I need to keep Monoco out of trouble.

speaker: Verso
line: Monoco’s all grown up now, and it’s your turn to be the patate.

speaker: Noco
line: Meh.

speaker: Verso
line: So eloquent.

speaker: Noco
line: (mischievous laugh)

speaker: Monoco
line: Is Golgra still mad at me?

speaker: Verso
line: What do you think?

speaker: Monoco
line: Ehhhh. Well, Golgra helped Noco start his merchant shop…

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, but defying Golgra wasn’t Noco’s idea, was it?

speaker: Monoco
line: Noco would’ve done the same for me.

speaker: Verso
line: Noco would’ve got Golgra on his side first.

speaker: Monoco
line: Bah. It’s been ten years! Golgra needs to get over it.

speaker: Esquie
line: Ok. Momo is Momo and Nono is Nono.

speaker: Verso
line: Uh..

speaker: Esquie
line: Then we’ve got Lulu, Maemae, and Scisci…

speaker: Verso
line: Eh… I don’t think they’ll like that-

speaker: Esquie
line: You sure you don’t wanna be Verver?

speaker: Verso
line: Positive.

speaker: Esquie
line: (blows a raspberry)

speaker: narrator
line: Maelle finds a spot where she can write. She spends some time writing in Gustave’s journal, to honour his memory. She writes about their encounter with Monoco and how exciting it is to travel with a Gestral. She hopes Gustave’s apprentices will read this journal someday.

speaker: Monoco
line: You see, there was a Stalact and I smashed it, utterly destroyed it. I did it in two attacks, plenty of damage. There was nothing left. And then there was a giant Pélerin that attacked. It was tough, but I defeated it no problem.

speaker: Verso
line: Pèlerins are weak. I could have done that blindfolded.

speaker: Monoco
line: This expedition is gloomy.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah. They lost a lot of friends, and they just buried another. Grieving takes time.

speaker: Monoco
line: How ‘bout a little “Verso magic” to lighten the mood.

speaker: Verso
line: You mean the one that hurts like hell?

speaker: Monoco
line: Yes, I mean the one that hurts like hell.

speaker: Verso
line: All right, all right, I’ll do it.

speaker: Verso
line: Hi.

speaker: Maelle
line: Not now, please, I’m working.

speaker: Verso
line: Hi.

speaker: Lune
line: Oh, Verso, there you are. How did- Ah! Fuck!

speaker: Sciel
line: Oh my- Wow-

speaker: Maelle
line: What is that-

speaker: Verso
line: Hi. I’m a pair of legs that can talk.

speaker: Lune
line: Verso?

speaker: Verso
line: We’re both Verso.

speaker: Maelle
line: You are so ridiculous.

speaker: Lune
line: Wait. How can your legs talk?

speaker: Verso
line: Ah, yes, I’m quite proud of that. Took a lot of training.

speaker: Sciel
line: Does it- does it hurt?

speaker: Verso
line: Ahhh-ah-ah-ah! No, it doesn’t!

speaker: Maelle
line: Did you cut yourself in half? Did Monoco cut you in half?

speaker: Lune
line: Do you heal from the top or the bottom? Or do you have to bring the halves together? Hey, can you control the process?

speaker: Sciel
line: So if you’re cut in half, does that mean you can be in two places at once? Can you go scouting with Monoco with your lower body while your upper body stays here and talks to us?

speaker: Verso
line: Well, yeah, you see, I can go hunt Nevrons with my top half, while my bottom remains here cooking meals. Back in the days, that’s what I used to do…

speaker: Lune
line: Can I- Are you? Huh?

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, my hair is…

speaker: Monoco
line: All that pain just to put a smile on their faces. Verso, aren’t you getting too attached?

speaker: narrator
line: Maelle stares at the stars. Sciel joins her in silence. They sit together for a while, watching the sky above.

speaker: Maelle
line: Can you teach me to fight better?

speaker: Sciel
line: Better?

speaker: Maelle
line: That white-haired bastard hit us before we even knew he was there. I want to be ready next time. And you’re the best fighter I know.

speaker: Sciel
line: High praise.

speaker: Maelle
line: We both know they’ll come back. I want to strike first.

speaker: Sciel
line: Emotions are powerful. But if you let them take control, they’ll work against you.

speaker: Maelle
line: I get that.

speaker: Sciel
line: Alright then. First lesson. You need to see. Truly see. Your eyes tell the truth, but your mind? It can lie.

speaker: Maelle
line: How?

speaker: Sciel
line: Emotions distort perception. You’ll miss details. Lock onto the wrong thing. Or see what you

speaker: Sciel
line: want

speaker: Sciel
line: to see.

speaker: Maelle
line: So what do I do?

speaker: Sciel
line: See things as they are. Not as you fear them, not as you wish they’d be. Study your opponent—how they move, how they react. Understand them so you can anticipate, adjust, survive.

speaker: Maelle
line: Hm.

speaker: Sciel
line: In battle, it’s just you, your weapon, and your enemy. You need to understand all three. Everyone has blind spots. So ask yourself—every day—what’s yours? What’s theirs?

speaker: Maelle
line: I thought this would be more… I dunno, technique.

speaker: narrator
line: Maelle and Sciel continue training together under the stars. A quiet bond strengthens between them.
